chargeHist.descr: Repeated Sexual Assault of Same Child (At Least 3 Violations of 1st or 2nd Degree Sexual Assault)

result.execSummary:
The defendant Jerome P. Gravelle was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • 2nd Degree Sexual Assault of Child, a class C felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.02(2).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

charges.descr: Repeated Sexual Assault of Same Child (At Least 3 Violations of 1st or 2nd Degree Sexual Assault)

supervisions.notes:
Dodge Correctional Institution as reception facility. 
Defendant is not eligible for the Substance Abuse Program.  
Defendant is not eligible for Challenge Incarceration Program.

If the stayed portion of the sentence is imposed and there are outstanding financial obligations, the supervising agent shall provide current financial information to the court.  A civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for any balances due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect all debt.

miscConds.notes: If probation or extended supervision is allowed to expire or is revoked with outstanding financial obligations, the supervising agent shall notify the court 10 days prior to the revocation or discharge and provide current financial information.  A civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for any balances due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect all debt.

Must have no contact with the victim or her family. 
Must have no unsupervised contact with juvenile females outside of his immediate family.

Must undergo a psychosexual evaluation and comply with recommended treatment and counseling. 
Must undergo anger management counseling and comply with recommended treatment. 
Must report as a sex offender until such time as he successfully completes his sentence. 
Must submit DNA sample.

10/13/2015 AMENDED: DEFENDANT IS REQUIRED TO REGISTER AS A SEX OFFENDER FOR LIFE.

timeConds.notes:
Must report forthwith. 
Huber/Work release granted. 
Sentence may be served in Polk County if at no cost to Barron County.
